name: Apricot
notes: Early bloomer. Requires winter chill hours (300-900) for fruit set. Avoid waterlogging; requires well-draining soil.

name: Arugula
notes: Fast-growing cool-season crop. Bolts in heat; providing shade prolongs the harvest and reduces bitterness.

name: Asparagus
notes: Long-lived perennial (15-20 years). Requires 2-3 years to establish; do not harvest in the first year to build crown strength.

name: Banana
notes: Fast-growing herbaceous perennial. Heavy feeder; requires high potassium and consistent moisture. Sensitive to frost (stops growth below 10°C).

name: Basil
notes: Fragrant annual herb. Improves tomato flavor when grown together. Pinch off flower buds to maintain leaf flavor and prolong harvest. Avoid cold drafts and frost.

name: Beet
notes: Cool-season crop. Soaking seeds for 24 hours improves germination. Harvest young (golf ball size) for best flavor and texture.

name: Bell Pepper
notes: Heat-loving crop. Requires consistently warm soil (above 15°C) and staking for heavy fruit. Avoid high-nitrogen fertilizer once flowers appear.

name: Birds Eye Chilli
notes: Small, extremely hot chilli. Tender perennial in tropics. Requires high heat and humidity; protect from frost and temperatures below 12°C. Pinch tips for bushier growth.

name: Bitter Gourd (Karela)
notes: Vining plant; requires strong trellis support; very high medicinal value.

name: Blueberry
notes: Requires highly acidic soil (pH 4.5-5.5). Shallow-rooted; keep consistently moist. Cross-pollinating multiple varieties improves yield and fruit size. Benefits from pine needle mulch.

name: Borage
notes: Excellent companion for many vegetables. Star-shaped blue flowers are edible and attract bees. Readily self-seeds; has a deep taproot and dislikes transplanting.

name: Bottle Gourd
notes: Night flowering.

name: Broccoli
notes: Cool-season crop. Requires consistent moisture for head development. Harvest main head first to encourage side shoot growth. Rotate crops to avoid clubroot.

name: Brussels Sprout
notes: Cool-season crop with a long growing season. Frost improves flavor. Remove lower leaves as sprouts develop. May require staking to support tall stalks.

name: Butternut Squash
notes: Long growing season.

name: Cacao
notes: Shade tree required.

name: Cantaloupe
notes: Heat-loving vine. Requires pollinators for fruit set. Indicators of ripeness include musky aroma and 'full slip' (stem detaches easily). Avoid overhead watering.

name: Carrot
notes: Soil must be stone-free for straight roots.

name: Cauliflower
notes: Cool-season crop. Sensitive to temperature fluctuations. May require 'blanching' (tying leaves over curd) to protect from sun and maintain white color. Heavy feeder.

name: Cabbage
notes: Cool-season crop. Surface feeders; avoid deep cultivation. Consistent moisture prevents head splitting. Harvest when heads are firm.

name: Celery
notes: Cool-season crop. Extremely high water and nutrient needs. Use mulch to keep roots cool and moist. Stalks from trench varieties may need 'blanching' for a milder flavor.

name: Bok Choy
notes: Cool-season crop. Fast-growing; harvest in as little as 30 days for baby leaves. Sensitive to heat; bolts quickly above 25°C. Prefers consistently moist soil.

name: Cherimoya
notes: Subtropical fruit tree. Extremely sensitive to frost and dry heat. Requires hand pollination for reliable yield. Brittle branches; protect from strong winds.

name: Chilli Pepper
notes: Tropical subshrub producing small, intense chillies. Perennial in warm climates. Requires consistently warm soil and full sun. High capsaicin content; handle with care.

name: Chive
notes: Hardy perennial. Edible flowers attract pollinators. Masking scent deters pests. Divide clumps every 2-4 years to maintain vigor.

name: Collard Greens
notes: Cold hardy.

name: Coriander / Cilantro
notes: Fast-growing annual herb. Leaves (cilantro) and seeds (coriander) are both edible. Prone to bolting (flowering prematurely) in hot weather. Succession planting every 2-3 weeks recommended for a steady supply of leaves.

name: Cosmos
notes: Hardy, easy-to-grow annual. Lacy foliage and daisy-like blooms from summer to first frost. Highly attractive to pollinators and beneficial insects like lacewings and hoverflies. Drought tolerant; performs better in less fertile soil.

name: Cucumber
notes: Heat-loving, vining plant. Benefits significantly from trellising to improve air circulation and keep fruit clean. Sensitive to frost. Consistent, deep watering is crucial to prevent bitter-tasting fruits.

name: Curry Leaf
notes: Tropical to subtropical evergreen aromatic tree. Extremely sensitive to frost. Benefits from regular pruning to maintain a bushy shape and prevent it from becoming leggy. Requires warm soil and high humidity.

name: Dill
notes: Fast-growing annual herb with feathery foliage and umbrella-shaped yellow flowers. Highly beneficial in the garden for attracting predatory insects like hoverflies and ladybugs. Prone to bolting (going to seed) in high heat; succession plant every few weeks for a continuous supply of leaves.

name: Eggplant
notes: Warm-season vegetable requiring long growing season (80+ days). Sensitive to frost and cold temperatures. Heavy feeder requiring consistent moisture. Stake plants when they reach 30cm to support fruit-laden branches.

name: Garlic
notes: Biennial grown as annual. Requires vernalization (10 weeks below 8°C) for proper bulb formation. Plant cloves pointed-end up in fall, 1-2 weeks after first frost. Hardneck varieties produce edible scapes. Heavy feeder requiring nitrogen.

name: Geranium
notes: Tender perennial.

name: Ginger
notes: Tropical herbaceous perennial grown for aromatic rhizomes. Requires 8-10 months to mature. Plant rhizome pieces with buds pointing up, 2-4 inches deep. Pre-sprout indoors in late winter. Sensitive to waterlogging and frost.

name: Green Bean
notes: Nitrogen-fixing legume.

name: Habanero Pepper
notes: Extremely hot pepper requiring long growing season (90-120 days). Grows 4-7 feet tall; needs staking. Start seeds indoors 6-10 weeks before last frost. Optimal temps 22-30°C. Reduce watering once peppers form to increase heat. Handle with gloves.

name: Kale
notes: Hardy biennial grown as annual. Cold-tolerant; flavor improves after frost. Heavy feeder requiring nitrogen-rich soil. Prone to bolting in heat. Practice 3-4 year crop rotation to prevent disease buildup.

name: Lavender
notes: Mediterranean perennial requiring excellent drainage. Drought-tolerant once established. Highly susceptible to root rot in waterlogged soil. Prune annually after flowering; avoid cutting into old wood. Reaches maturity in 3-5 years.

name: Lemon
notes: Sensitive to frost; heavy feeder.

name: Lettuce
notes: Cool-season crop with shallow roots. Succession plant every 2 weeks for continuous harvest. Bolts (flowers) in heat above 25°C, making leaves bitter. Benefits from partial shade in summer. Harvest in early morning for crispest leaves.

name: Mint
notes: Invasive roots.

name: Money Plant
notes: Hardy air purifier.

name: Monstera
notes: Toxic to pets.

name: Moringa (Drumstick Tree)
notes: Fastest growing tree; every part of the plant is edible; extremely drought resistant.

name: Nasturtium
notes: Trap crop for aphids.

name: Okra (Bhindi)
notes: Heat and drought tolerant; harvest pods when small and tender.

name: Onion
notes: Day-length sensitive.

name: Oregano
notes: Perennial herb.

name: Papaya
notes: Avoid waterlogging.

name: Parsley
notes: Slow germination.

name: Carrot
notes: Direct sow only; dislikes transplanting. Requires stone-free, loose soil for straight roots. Consistent moisture is key for flavor. Thinnings are edible.

name: Pea
notes: Nitrogen fixer; cool season crop.

name: Petunia
notes: Requires deadheading.

name: Plum
notes: Needs cross pollination.

name: Potato
notes: Hill soil around stems to increase yield.

name: Pumpkin
notes: Requires space.

name: Radish
notes: Fastest growing crop.

name: Raspberry
notes: Prune second-year canes after harvest.

name: Blackberry
notes: Vigorous biennial canes. Requires 2-3 years to establish. Prune second-year floricanes after harvest. Trellising recommended for better yield and air circulation.

name: Rosemary
notes: Perennial; avoid overwatering.

name: Sage
notes: Woody perennial.

name: Spinach
notes: Cool season crop; bolts in heat.

name: Strawberry
notes: Mulch with straw to keep fruit off ground.

name: Sunflower
notes: Allelopathic properties.

name: Sweet Corn
notes: Wind pollinated; plant in blocks for better pollination.

name: Swiss Chard
notes: Tolerates light frost.

name: Thyme
notes: Drought-tolerant.

name: Tomato
notes: Requires staking and consistent watering.

name: Turmeric
notes: Long growing season (9 months).

name: Turnip
notes: Greens edible.

name: Watermelon
notes: Needs long warm season.

name: Yardlong Bean
notes: Vigorous climber.

name: Zinnia
notes: Attracts butterflies.

name: Zucchini
notes: Heavy feeder; harvest regularly.

name: Rose
notes: Requires regular pruning and good air circulation.

name: Marigold
notes: Known for suppressing soil nematodes.

name: Apple Tree
notes: Requires winter chill hours for proper fruiting.

name: Fern
notes: Prefers consistently moist soil and shade.

name: Spider Plant
notes: Highly tolerant of indoor conditions and low light.

name: Lemon Tree
notes: Sensitive to frost; often container-grown in cooler climates.

name: Boxwood
notes: Commonly used for hedging and topiary.
